meanings.definition: Not able to be maintained or defended
meanings.sent1: The argument's untenability became clear when no evidence supported it.
meanings.sent2: The roof's untenability led to its collapse under the heavy snow.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a flying elephant is as untenable as a fish riding a bicycle.
meanings.sent4: Her promise to never get angry again was as untenable as trying to hold back a tidal wave.
meanings.sent5: The kitten's attempt to climb the slippery, vertical wall was a perfect example of untenability.

meanings.definition: The quality of being unable to be supported or justified
meanings.sent1: The project's untenability was evident when the budget was exceeded by millions.
meanings.sent2: The untenability of his alibi was exposed when security footage showed him elsewhere.
meanings.sent3: The unicorn's claim of being late due to traffic was an amusing display of untenability.
meanings.sent4: The untenability of the dictator's rule crumbled like a sandcastle in a storm.
meanings.sent5: The student's excuse for not doing homework was an example of untenability that the teacher couldn't ignore.
